481 Perguruan Tinggi Islam Belum Terakreditasi, Lulusannya Terancam Sulit Bekerja
07 Nov 2019, 04:32 by Yusuf Wijanarko
JAKARTA, (PR).- Ketua Komisi VIII Dewan Perwakilan Rakyat Yandri Susanto mempertanyakan 481 perguruan tinggi keagamaan Islam negeri (PTKIN) yang belum terakreditasi.
"Sejumlah 481 PTKIN belum terakreditasi, ini persoalan serius," kata Yandri dalam rapat kerja bersama DPR-Kementerian Agama mengenai evaluasi anggaran tahun 2019 dan rencana anggaran 2020 di Jakarta, Kamis 7 November 2019.
Menurut dia, apabila PTKIN tidak kunjung mendapat akreditasi, akan menyulitkan mahasiswa kampus terkait dalam mencari pekerjaan.
Politisi Partai Amanat Nasional itu mengatakan, terdapat sejumlah instansi yang menyeleksi calon karyawannya dengan salah satu pertimbangannya akreditas kampus terkait.
"Kalau tidak terakreditasi, mahasiswanya akan sulit mencari pekerjaan, untuk jadi ASN atau pekerjaan lain," kata dia seperti dilaporkan Antara.
Rapat kerja antara DPR dan Kementerian Agama dihadiri para pimpinan Komisi VIII, termasuk Menteri Agama Fachrul Razi beserta jajarannya.
Fachrul Razi memaparkan program-program Kemenag yang sudah dijalankan.
Sebagai rapat perdana pada era anggota legislatif dan Menag yang baru, kesempatan tersebut menjadi ajang kedua belah pihak untuk saling mendalami partner kerja yaitu DPR selaku pengawas pemerintahan, sedangkan Kementerian Agama sebagai eksekutif.***

481 Islamic Universities Not Accredited, Graduates Threatened Difficult to Work
Nov 7 2019, 04:32 by Yusuf Wijanarko
JAKARTA, (PR) .- Chair of Commission VIII of the House of Representatives Yandri Susanto questioned 481 state Islamic religious colleges (PTKIN) that have not been accredited.
"As many as 481 PTKIN have not been accredited, this is a serious problem," Yandri said in a joint meeting of the DPR-Ministry of Religion regarding the evaluation of the 2019 budget and 2020 budget plan in Jakarta, Thursday, November 7, 2019.
According to him, if PTKIN did not get accreditation, it would be difficult for university students to find work.
The National Mandate Party politician said, there are a number of agencies that select prospective employees with one consideration of the associated campus accreditation.
"If it is not accredited, students will find it difficult to find work, to become an ASN or another job," he said as reported by Antara.
The working meeting between the DPR and the Ministry of Religion was attended by leaders of Commission VIII, including Minister of Religion Fachrul Razi and his staff.
Fachrul Razi explained the Ministry of Religion programs that had been implemented.
As an inaugural meeting in the era of new members of the legislature and the Minister of Religion, the opportunity was a place for both parties to explore each other's work partners namely the House of Representatives as the government supervisor, while the Ministry of Religion as an executive. ***
